module.name: LazConfigStorage
module.short: Defines various base classes for loading and saving configuration files.

descr.p: lazconfigstorage.pas is part of the LazUtils package.
Author: Mattias Gaertner

element.name: TConfigStorage
element.short: Defines the base class for a configuration storage mechanism.

descr.p: TConfigStorage is a class used to create and maintain configuration information using an XML-based storage format. TConfigStorage is a base class; it contains abstract virtual methods which must be implemented in descendent class to provide memory- or file-based storage for its values.

TConfigStorage and descendent classes have a base path where its data is stored, and sub-paths and values for the data items in the storage. Path information uses an XPath-like notation which indicates where a given value is stored, and the name associated with the stored value.
For example:
Values can be specified using one of the native Pascal data types supported in the class, like:
Methods are provided to get, set, or delete stored items using their path notation. Methods are also provided to read or write published property values to or from persistent objects using RTTI.
Do not create instances of TConfigStorage. Use of the descendent classes like TConfigMemStorage or TXMLConfigStorage.

element.name: TConfigStorage.FPathStack
element.short: Contains a path history built using AppendBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.FCurrentBasePath
element.short: Member used to store the value in CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFullPathValue
element.short: Specifies a method used to get a value or its default from the specified fully-qualified path.

descr.p: Returns the value stored using the path and name in the APath argument. The value in ADefault is returned if APath is not found in the configuration storage. The overloaded variants allow the return and default values to be specified using String, Integer, or Boolean types.
GetFullPathValue is an abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It is implemented in a descendent class to use the storage mechanism for the class instance.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFullPathValue.Result
element.short: Value in the configuration storage for the specified value type.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFullPathValue.APath
element.short: Fully-qualified path to the value. Includes both the base path and the name for the item.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFullPathValue.ADefault
element.short: Default value returned when APath is not found in the configuration storage.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetFullPathValue
element.short: Defines the method used to resolve the specified node path prior to storing the specified value.

descr.p: SetFullPathValue is an overloaded abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It must be overridden in a descendent class to use the node notation required for the underlying storage mechanism.
SetFullPathValue is called from the SetValue method after ExtendPath has been called to include the CurrentBasePath value at the start of the node path in APath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetFullPathValue.APath
element.short: Path to the node where the specified value is stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetFullPathValue.AValue
element.short: Value stored in the specified node path. Overloaded variants allow AValue to be specified using as either a String, an Integer, or a Boolean type.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue
element.short: Defines the method used to delete the specified node path or to reset it to a default value.

descr.p: SetDeleteFullPathValue is an overloaded abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It must be overridden and implemented in a descendent class to use the node notation required for the underlying storage mechanism.

Overloaded variants of the method allow the AValue and DefValue arguments to be passed as either String, Integer, or Boolean types. Both arguments must use the same type. The arguments determine whether the node is removed or updated with a default value in the storage mechanism. When both arguments have the same value, the node at APath is deleted from the storage. Otherwise, the value in DefValue is stored for the specified node.
SetDeleteFullPathValue is called from the SetDeleteValue method after ExtendPath has been called to include the CurrentBasePath value at the start of the node path in APath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.APath
element.short: Path to the node updated or removed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.AValue
element.short: Value for the node to update or remove in the method. Causes the node to be deleted when its value matches DefValue.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.DefValue
element.short: Default value stored in the node when AValue does not match DefValue.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteFullPath
element.short: Defines the method used to remove the node at the specified path from the configuration storage.

descr.p: DeleteFullPath is an abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It must be implemented in a descendent class to perform actions needed to remove the specified node from the storage mechanism for the class instance.
DeleteFullPath always physically removes the node at the specified path. Use SetDeleteFullPathValue to update or remove a node using a value and default value.
DeleteFullPath is used to implement the DeletePath method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteFullPath.APath
element.short: Path to the node deleted in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteFullPathValue
element.short: Defines the method used to delete the node with the specified full path name from the configuration storage.

descr.p: DeleteFullPathValue is an abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage used to delete the node with the path name specified in APath. It must be implemented in a descendent class to access the storage mechanism for the derived class instance.
DeleteFullPathValue is used to implement the DeleteValue method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteFullPathValue.APath
element.short: Fully-qualified path name for the node deleted in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty
element.short: Stores one or more property values from an RTTI-enabled persistent object to the specified path in the configuration storage.

descr.p: WriteProperty is based on the actions performed by the TWriter class in the FPC RTL. Is uses the RTTI property information passed in the PropInfo argument to access each of the properties in Instance. No actions are performed for a given property if it does not provide both a getter and a setter routine for the property value.
APath contains the fully-qualified path where value(s) are stored in the configuration storage.
Instance is the RTTI-enabled persistent object with the value(s) retrieved and written in the method.

PropInfo in a pointer to type information for the persistent object in Instance (and DefInstance). It is used to access each property, and to convert and store each value in the storage mechanism by calling the SetValue method.

OnlyProperty contains an optional name for a single property name stored in the method. When omitted (or set to an empty string), all of the properties in the type information are stored starting at the specified path using the Name for the property type as an identifier.

DefInstance is a persistent object which contains values to be treated as the default values for the corresponding properties in Instance. When a property has the same value in both Instance and DefInstance, it is deleted from the configuration storage. DefInstance can be Nil - but default property values cannot be determined when omitted.
WriteProperty handles values for the following type kinds in property type information:

ul.li: tkInteger (including string identifiers for the value)
tkSet (as comma-delimited identifiers in the set)

descr.p: The following type kinds are not explicitly handled in the current LCL version:

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty.Path
element.short: Path where property value(s) from the specified object are stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty.Instance
element.short: Persistent object with the property value(s) stored in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty.PropInfo
element.short: Pointer to the RTTI property information processed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty.DefInstance
element.short: Persistent object with the default value(s) for properties processed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteProperty.OnlyProperty
element.short: Specifies a single property name to the stored in the method. All properties in PropInfo are stored when omitted (or set to '').

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadProperty
element.short: Reads value(s) from a path in the configuration storage into the specified persistent object.

descr.p: ReadProperty is based on the actions performed by the TReader class in the FPC RTL. Is uses the RTTI property information passed in the PropInfo argument to store the property values in Instance. No actions are performed if the property information does not have both a getter and a setter routine for the property value.
APath contains the fully-qualified path where value(s) are stored in the configuration storage.
Instance is the RTTI-enabled persistent object where value(s) read from the configuration storage are stored in the method.

PropInfo in a pointer to type information for the persistent object in Instance (and DefInstance). It is used to access each property, and to convert and store each value from the storage mechanism using RTTI routines.

OnlyProperty contains an optional name for a single property name handled in the method. When omitted (or set to an empty string), all of the properties in the type information are read and stored in the properties starting at the specified path.

DefInstance is a persistent object which contains values to be treated as the default values for the corresponding properties in Instance. If DefInstance is not specified (or contains Nil), the Instance argument is assigned to DefInstance.
ReadProperty handles values for the following type kinds in property type information:

ul.li: tkInteger (including integer which have a string identifier)

descr.p: The following type kinds are not explicitly handled in the current LCL version:

element.short: Path where property value(s) are stored in the configuration storage.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadProperty.Instance
element.short: Persistent object where value(s) read from storage are stored in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadProperty.PropInfo
element.short: Pointer to the RTTI property information processed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadProperty.DefInstance
element.short: Persistent object with the default value(s) for properties processed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadProperty.OnlyProperty
element.short: Specifies a single property name to the stored in the method. All properties in PropInfo are stored when omitted (or set to '').

element.name: TConfigStorage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.remark: Create has an empty implementation in TConfigStorage. Use one of the descendent classes which re-implements the constructor as needed for its storage mechanism.

element.name: TConfigStorage.Create.Filename
element.short: File name where configuration data is stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.Create.LoadFromDisk
element.short: True to load values from the specified file if it exists. False to create a new, empty storage.

element.name: TConfigStorage.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It frees resources allocated for members in the class instance, and calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TConfigStorage.Clear
element.short: Clears the content in the configuration storage.

descr.p: Clear is an abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It is implemented in descendent classes to provide a file- or memory-based storage mechanism.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue
element.short: Gets the value stored at the specified path relative to the base path in the configuration storage.

descr.p: GetValue is an overloaded method in TConfigStorage. The overloaded variants allow the value read from the specified path in the configuration storage to be returned as one of the following types:
ADefault contains the default value returned if a value is not found in the storage for the specified path. The argument uses the same type as the return value for the overloaded methods.

GetValue calls GetFullPathValue after using ExtendPath to insert the value CurrentBasePath at the start of the value in APath. The value in ADefault is passed to GetFullPathValue as the default value.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.Result
element.short: Returns the value stored at the specified path.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.APath
element.short: Path in the configuration storage relative to CurrentBasePath where the value is stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.ADefault
element.short: Default value used when a value is not found at the specified path.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.ARect
element.short: Returns the value read from the configuration storage as a TRect type.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.APoint
element.short: Returns the value read from the configuration storage as a TPoint type.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetValue.List
element.short: Returns the value read from the configuration storage as a TStrings type.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetValue
element.short: Stores a value at the specified path in the configuration storage.

descr.p: SetValue is an overloaded method in TConfigStorage used to store the value specified in the AValue argument to the node path in APath. The overloaded variants allow AValue to be specified using String, Integer, Boolean, TRect, or TPoint types.
APath contains the node path where the value is stored in the storage mechanism. SetValue calls the ExtendPath method to include the value in CurrentBasePath prior to the specified node path.

The SetFullPathValue method is called to store AValue to the underlying storage mechanism. Overloads for TRect and TPoint are decomposed and stored as the members values for the types. For TRect: Left, Top, Right, and Bottom are stored. For TPoint: X and Y are stored.
Use GetValue to read a stored value for a specified node path.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetValue.APath
element.short: Node path (relative to CurrentBasePath) where the specified value is stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetValue.AValue
element.short: Value stored for the specified node path.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteValue
element.short: Updates the value for the specified node path, or deletes it when it contains a default value.

descr.p: SetDeleteValue is an overloaded method in TConfigStorage. The variants allow the method to be used to store a value using either a String, Integer, Boolean, TRect, or TPoint type in the AValue argument.

APath is the path to the node where the value is stored. It is specified with a value relative to the CurrentBasePath property. ExtendPath is called to insert CurrentBasePath at the start of the node path.
DefValue contains the value treated as the default value for the node path. The overloaded variants use the same type as specified in the AValue argument.

SetDeleteValue calls the SetDeleteFullPathValue method to update or remove the value at the specified path. When DefValue is equal to AValue, the node path in APath to be removed from the configuration storage.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteValue.APath
element.short: Path to the node value updated or removed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteValue.AValue
element.short: Value stored in the specified node.

element.name: TConfigStorage.SetDeleteValue.DefValue
element.short: Default value which triggers removal of the node when it is the same as AValue.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeletePath
element.short: Removes the configuration storage node with the specified path.

descr.p: Calls ExtendPath to resolve APath to the CurrentBasePath for the storage. Calls DeleteFullPath to remove the resolved path to the storage node.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeletePath.APath
element.short: Path to the node removed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteValue
element.short: Deletes the value stored for the specified path.

descr.p: Calls ExtendPath to resolve APath to the CurrentBasePath for the storage. Calls DeleteFullPathValue to remove value for the resolved node path.

element.name: TConfigStorage.DeleteValue.APath
element.short: Relative path to the node removed in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.CurrentBasePath
element.short: Contains the base node path where values are read or written in the storage mechanism.

descr.p: CurrentBasePath is a read-only String property. Its value is updated when the AppendBasePath and UndoAppendBasePath methods are called in the class instance. The value is used when the ExtendPath method is called to resolve a relative node path to its location in the storage mechanism.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ExtendPath
element.short: Resolves a relative node path to the current base path for the storage mechanism.

descr.p: Inserts the value in CurrentBasePath as a prefix for the value in APath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ExtendPath.Result
element.short: Path to a node after it has been resolved to CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ExtendPath.APath
element.short: Relative node path extended with the value in CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.AppendBasePath
element.short: Appends the specified relative path to the existing value in CurrentBasePath.

descr.p: AppendBasePath is a method used to append the relative path specified for a node in Path to the value in the CurrentBasePath property. AppendBasePath ensures that a trailing path delimiter ('/') is appended to the value in CurrentBasePath when it not empty and does not already include the delimiter.
Use UndoAppendBasePath to remove a path node from the value in CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.AppendBasePath.Path
element.short: Relative path added to the value in CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.UndoAppendBasePath
element.short: Removes the last node path from the value in CurrentBasePath.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteToDisk
element.short: Defines the method used to flush the values in the configuration storage to the underlying storage mechanism.

descr.p: WriteToDisk is an abstract virtual method in TConfigStorage. It must be implemented in a descendent class to perform actions needed to store values to the mechanism used in a derived class.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFilename
element.short: Defines the method used to get the file name where configuration data is stored.

descr.p: GetFileName is an abstract virtual String function in TConfigStorage. It is used to retrieve the file name where configuration data is stored when the WriteToDisk method is called. It must be implemented in a descendent class which uses a file as the destination for the storage mechanism.

element.name: TConfigStorage.GetFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the file name where the configuration data is stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteObject
element.short: Stores property names and values in the specified object to the configuration storage.

descr.p: WriteObject is a method used to store names and values from the properties in the specified persistent object into the configuration storage.
Path contains the location in configuration storage where the property values are stored. It provides a unique location for the values stored in the method.
Obj is the TPersistent instance with the property values stored in the method.

WriteObject calls WriteProperty for each of the properties returned from the RTL GetPropList routine. Sub-paths representing each of the published properties in the object are created by calling the WriteProperty method.

WriteObject (and WriteProperty) rely on RTTI types and routines to get the values from the persistent object. As such, only published properties can be serialized; the FPC RTL does not provide RTTI type information for other protected or public visibility at this time. The properties must have getter and setter routines (read and write specifiers); otherwise, they are omitted from the serialized values.
Use the OnlyProperty argument to specify the name for a single property in Obj that should be written in the method. Otherwise, all properties are stored.
Use ReadObject to read values from a given path into a persistent object instance.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteObject.Path
element.short: Path where property names and values from Obj are stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteObject.Obj
element.short: Persistent object with properties stored in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteObject.DefObject
element.short: Persistent object with default values for the properties in Obj.

element.name: TConfigStorage.WriteObject.OnlyProperty
element.short: Name for a single property that should be written in the method, instead of all properties.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadObject
element.short: Reads names and values from the configuration storage into properties for the specified object instance.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadObject.Path
element.short: Path where the property names and values read in the method are stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadObject.Obj
element.short: Persistent object where the values read in the method are stored.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadObject.DefObject
element.short: Persistent object with the default values for properties updated in the method.

element.name: TConfigStorage.ReadObject.OnlyProperty
element.short: Name for a single property value read and stored in Obj.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue
element.short: Implements the method used to delete the specified node path or to reset it to a default value.

descr.p: SetDeleteFullPathValue is an overloaded overridden method in TConfigMemStorage. Overloaded variants of the method allow the AValue and DefValue arguments to be passed as either String, Integer, or Boolean types. Both arguments must use the same type. The arguments determine whether the node is removed or updated with a default value in the storage mechanism. When both arguments have the same value, the node at APath is deleted from the storage. Otherwise, the value in DefValue is stored for the specified node.
SetDeleteFullPathValue is called from the SetDeleteValue method after ExtendPath has been called to include the CurrentBasePath value at the start of the node path in APath.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.APath
element.short: Path to the node updated or removed in the method.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.AValue
element.short: Value for the node to update or remove in the method. Causes the node to be deleted when its value matches DefValue.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetDeleteFullPathValue.DefValue
element.short: Default value stored in the node when AValue does not match DefValue.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetFullPathValue
element.short: Implements the method used to resolve the specified node path prior to storing the specified value.

The overloaded variants convert AValue to a String type (when needed) and stores the value in a memory-based configuration node with the fully-qualified path specified in APath.
SetFullPathValue is called from the SetValue method after ExtendPath has been called to include the CurrentBasePath value at the start of the node path in APath.

element.short: Resolved path to the node where the specified value is stored.

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.SetFullPathValue.AValue

element.name: TConfigMemStorage.Root
element.short: TConfigMemStorageNode instance with the root node for the configuration storage.

descr.p: Root is a TConfigMemStorageNode member with the root node for the storage. The node is created (when needed) when a value is stored to the memory-based configuration storage, and freed when the class instance is destroyed. Nodes in the storage are accessed starting at the Root node, and navigated by accessing the child nodes recursively. The node path reflects the hierarchy of nodes accessed to reach a specific node.

element.short: Default locale-independent format used for date values in DateToCfgStr.

element.name: DateTimeAsCfgStrFormat
element.short: Default locale-independent format used for date/time values.

element.name: DateToCfgStr
element.short: Returns a string representation for TDateTime value using the specified format.

element.name: DateToCfgStr.Result
element.short: String with the date and/or time represented using the specified format.

element.name: DateToCfgStr.Date
element.short: TDateTime value converted in the routine.

element.name: DateToCfgStr.AFormat
element.short: Format for the date/time value. Default value is defined in the DateAsCfgStrFormat constant and represents the date part of the specified value.

element.name: CfgStrToDate
element.short: Converts a string with a date/time value using the specified format to the TDateTime output value.

element.name: CfgStrToDate.Result
element.short: True if the string was successfully converted to a TDateTIme value in the routine.

element.name: CfgStrToDate.s
element.short: String with the date and/or time value converted in the routine.

element.name: CfgStrToDate.Date
element.short: Returns the TDateTime value for the specified string, or an empty TDateTime value (0.0) when the routine returns False.

element.name: CfgStrToDate.AFormat

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNames
element.short: Compares the specified PChar values to determine the relative order for the memory node paths.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNames.Result
element.short: Returns 0 if the arguments have the same value (or both are empty). Returns -1 if p1 has a shorter path length than (comes before) p2. Returns 1 if p1 has a longer path length than (comes after) p2.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNames.p1
element.short: Node path compared up to the first '/' or #0 character.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNames.p2
element.short: Node path compared up to the first '/' or #0 character.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNodes
element.short: Compares the names for the specified memory-based storage nodes to determine their relative order.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNodes.Result
element.short: Returns 0 if the node names have the same value (or both are empty). Returns -1 if Node1 has a node name shorter than (comes before) Node2. Returns 1 if Node1 has a node name longer than (comes before) Node2.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNodes.Node1
element.short: Memory-based storage node compared in the routine.

element.name: CompareConfigMemStorageNodes.Node2
element.short: Memory-based storage node compared in the routine.

element.name: ComparePCharWithConfigMemStorageNode
element.short: Compares the specified string to the name for a the specified memory-based storage nodes to determine their relative order.

element.name: ComparePCharWithConfigMemStorageNode.Result
element.short: Returns 0 if the string and the node name have the same value (or both are empty). Returns -1 if the string is shorter than (comes before) the node name in ANode. Returns 1 if the string is longer than (comes after) the node name in ANode.

element.name: ComparePCharWithConfigMemStorageNode.aPChar
element.short: Pointer to the null-terminated character values compared in the routine.

element.name: ComparePCharWithConfigMemStorageNode.ANode
element.short: Memory-based storage node with the name compared in the routine.
